title: Contributing to pkgmatch
text: try follow GitHub flow development. Fork repo clone computer. learn process, see guide. forked cloned project since worked , pull changes original repo clone using git pull upstream master. Open RStudio project file (.Rproj). Write code. Test code (bonus points adding unit tests). Document code (see function documentation ). Check code devtools::check() aim 0 errors warnings. Commit push changes. Submit pull request.

title: Contributing to pkgmatch
text: pkgmatch coding style diverges somewhat commonly used tidyverse style guide, primarily judicious use whitespace, aims improve code readability. Code references pkgmatch separated whitespace, just like words text. Just like easier understand ‚Äúthree words‚Äù ‚Äúthesethreewords‚Äù, code formatted like : like : position brackets arbitrary, also write pkgmatch code opts former style, natural result one ends writing space function (). can easily (re-)format code accord style installing spaceout package running:
code: these <- three (words (x)) these <- three(words(x)) these <- three( words (x)) this <- function () styler::style_pkg (style = spaceout::spaceout_style)

title: The pkgmatch package
text: package best understood example, starting loading package. match packages input string: default, top five matching packages printed screen. function actually returns information packages, along head method display first rows: head method also accepts n parameter control many rows displayed, .data.frame can used see entire data.frame results. following lines find equivalent matches packages currently CRAN:
code: library (pkgmatch) input <- "genomics and transcriptomics sequence data" pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input) #> [1] "onekp"         "UCSCXenaTools" "biomartr"      "restez"        #> [5] "DataPackageR" p <- pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input) head (p) #>         package rank #> 1         onekp    1 #> 2 UCSCXenaTools    2 #> 3      biomartr    3 #> 4        restez    4 #> 5  DataPackageR    5 pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input, corpus = "cran") #> [1] "microseq"       "read.gb"        "seq2R"          "tidysq"         #> [5] "rnaCrosslinkOO"

what: Using an R package as input
title: The pkgmatch package
text: package also accepts input path local R package. following code downloads ‚Äútarball‚Äù (.tar.gz file) CRAN finds matching packages corpus. course expect best matches CRAN packages include package : indeed . explained documentation, pkgmatch_similar_pkgs() function ranks final results combining several distinct components, primarily Large Language Model (LLM) embeddings, well conventional document token-frequency analyses. rankings components can seen head method:
code: u <- "https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/odbc_1.5.0.tar.gz" destfile <- file.path (tempdir (), basename (u)) download.file (u, destfile = destfile, quiet = TRUE) pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (destfile, corpus = "cran") #> $text #> [1] "odbc"              "rocker"            "connections"       #> [4] "DatabaseConnector" "DBI"               #>  #> $code #> [1] "odbc"     "RMariaDB" "RSQLite"  "noctua"   "RAthena" p <- pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (destfile, corpus = "cran") head (p) #>             package version text_rank code_rank #> 1              odbc   1.5.0         1         1 #> 2            rocker   0.3.1         2      1105 #> 3       connections   0.2.0         3       287 #> 4 DatabaseConnector   6.3.2         4        69 #> 5               DBI   1.2.3         5         9

title: The pkgmatch package
text: explained documentation main pkgmatch_similar_pkgs() function, ranks different components combined form single final ranking using Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) algorithm. function also includes additional llm_proportion parameter can used weight relative contributions different components. Results LLM component : Results component, comparing relative token frequencies CRAN packages, including frequencies code tokens, : notable differences two sets results. also explained documentation pkgmatch_similar_pkgs(), internal function calls locally cached, function can easily quickly re-run different values llm_proportion.
code: pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (destfile, corpus = "cran", llm_proportion = 1) #> $text #> [1] "odbc"         "rocker"       "FormShare"    "CDMConnector" "ODB"          #>  #> $code #> [1] "odbc"          "RODBCDBI"      "sjdbc"         "RODBC"         #> [5] "stacomirtools" pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (destfile, corpus = "cran", llm_proportion = 0) #> $text #> [1] "odbc"              "implyr"            "DatabaseConnector" #> [4] "sparklyr"          "gbifdb"            #>  #> $code #> [1] "odbc"      "pkgload"   "httr2"     "gganimate" "gargle"

what: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: tool help find R packages, matching packages either text description, given package. Can find matching packages either rOpenSci‚Äôs suite packages, packages currently CRAN.

title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: easiest way install package via associated r-universe. shown , simply enable universe install usual way , Alternatively, package can installed first installing either remotes pak packages running one following lines: package can loaded use package takes input either text description local path R package, finds similar packages based Large Language Model (LLM) embeddings, traditional text code matching algorithms. LLM embeddings require locally-running instance ollama, described following sub-section.
code: options (repos = c (     ropenscireviewtools = "https://ropensci-review-tools.r-universe.dev",     CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org" )) install.packages ("pkgmatch") remotes::install_github ("ropensci-review-tools/pkgmatch") pak::pkg_install ("ropensci-review-tools/pkgmatch") library (pkgmatch)

title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: package access LLM embeddings external APIs, reasons explained vignette("-local-lllms"). LLM embeddings extracted locally-running instance ollama. means need download install ollama computer order use package. downloaded, ollama can started calling ollama serve. particular models used extract embeddings automatically downloaded package needed, can manually running following two commands (system console; R): ‚Äôll likely need wait half hour models download proceeding.
code: ollama pull jina/jina-embeddings-v2-base-en ollama pull ordis/jina-embeddings-v2-base-code

title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: package two main functions: pkgmatch_similar_pkgs() find similar rOpenSci CRAN packages based input either local path entire package, single descriptive text string; pkgmatch_similar_fns() find similar functions rOpenSci packages based descriptive text input. (available functions CRAN packages.) following code demonstrates functions work, first matching general text strings packages rOpenSci: Corresponding websites can also automatically opened, either passing browse = TRUE, specifying return value passing pkgmatch_browse() function.
code: input <- " Packages for analysing evolutionary trees, with a particular focus on visualising inter-relationships among distinct trees. " pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input) ## [1] "lingtypology"   "treedata.table" "treestartr"     "babette"        ## [5] "canaper"

title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: input parameter can also local path entire package. following code finds similar packages package passing input = ".", default matching rOpenSci packages: similar packages terms text descriptions include several general search retrieval packages, pkgcheck package ropensci-review-tools suite. contrast, four five similar packages terms code structure packages ropensci-review-tools suite. Packages CRAN can matched specifying corpus parameter: input parameter can also local path compressed .tar.gz binary object directly downloaded CRAN.
code: pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (".") ## $text ## [1] "rdataretriever" "pkgcheck"       "c14bazAAR"      "elastic"        ## [5] "textreuse"      ##  ## $code ## [1] "autotest"    "pkgcheck"    "roreviewapi" "rtweet"      "srr" pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (".", corpus = "cran") ## $text ## [1] "searcher"   "typetracer" "ore"        "ehelp"      "RWsearch"   ##  ## $code ## [1] "remotes"   "RInno"     "workflowr" "cffr"      "miniCRAN"

title: Find R Packages Matching Either Descriptions or Other R Packages
text: additional function find functions within packages best match text description. Setting browse = TRUE open documentation pages corresponding best-matching functions.
code: input <- "A function to label a set of geographic coordinates" pkgmatch_similar_fns (input) ## [1] "GSODR::nearest_stations"          "refsplitr::plot_addresses_points" ## [3] "slopes::elevation_extract"        "quadkeyr::grid_to_polygon"        ## [5] "rnoaa::meteo_nearby_stations" input <- "Identify genetic sequences matching a given input fragment" pkgmatch_similar_fns (input) ## [1] "charlatan::SequenceProvider" "beastier::is_alignment"      ## [3] "charlatan::ch_gene_sequence" "beautier::is_phylo"          ## [5] "textreuse::align_local"

title: Calculate the
text: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okapi_BM25.

title: Calculate the
code: pkgmatch_bm25(input, txt = NULL, idfs = NULL, corpus = "ropensci")

title: Calculate the
text: input single character string match second parameter input documents. txt optional list input documents. specified, data loaded specified corpus parameter. idfs Optional list Inverse Document Frequency weightings generated internal bm25_idf function. specified, values rOpenSci corpus automatically downloaded used. corpus txt specified, data nominated corpus downloaded local cache directory, BM25 values calculated . Must one "ropensci", "ropensci-fns".

title: Calculate the
text: data.frame package names 'BM25' measures text whole packages without function descriptions.

title: Calculate the
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ input <- "Download open spatial data from NASA" bm25 <- pkgmatch_bm25 (input) # Or pre-load document-frequency weightings: idfs <- pkgmatch_load_data ("idfs", fns = FALSE) bm25 <- pkgmatch_bm25 (input, idfs = idfs) } # }

title: Calculate a
text: Calculate "BM25" index function-call frequencies local R package packages specified corpus.

title: Calculate a
code: pkgmatch_bm25_fn_calls(path, corpus = "ropensci")

title: Calculate a
text: path Local path source code R package. corpus One "ropensci" "cran"

title: Calculate a
text: data.frame two columns: "package" Naming package specified corpus; bm25 "BM25" index value nominated packages, high values indicate greater overlap term frequencies.

title: Calculate a
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ u <- "https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/odbc_1.5.0.tar.gz" path <- file.path (tempdir (), basename (u)) download.file (u, destfile = path) bm25 <- pkgmatch_bm25_fn_calls (path) } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ input <- "genomics and transcriptomics sequence data" p <- pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input) pkgmatch_browse (p) # Open main package pages on rOpenSci p <- pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input, corpus = "cran") pkgmatch_browse (p) # Open main package pages on CRAN p <- pkgmatch_similar_fns (input) pkgmatch_browse (p) # Open pages for best-matching rOpenSci functions } # }

title: Return raw 'LLM' embeddings from package text and function definitions. ‚Äî pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs
text: !functions_only, list two matrices embeddings: one text descriptions specified packages, including individual descriptions package functions, one entire code base. functions_only, single matrix embeddings function descriptions.

title: Return raw 'LLM' embeddings from package text and function definitions. ‚Äî pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ packages <- c ("cli", "fs") emb_fns <- pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs (packages, functions_only = TRUE) colnames (emb_fns) # All functions of the two packages emb_pkg <- pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs (packages, functions_only = FALSE) names (emb_pkg) # text_with_fns, text_wo_fns, code colnames (emb_pkg$text_with_fns) # cli, fs } # }

title: Load embeddings generated by the pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs function, either for all rOpenSci packages or, if fns = TRUE, all individual functions within those packages. ‚Äî pkgmatch_load_data
text: One : "embeddings" load pre-generated embeddings; "idfs" load pre-generated Inverse Document Frequency weightings; "functions" load pre-generated frequency tables text descriptions function calls; "calls" load pre-generated frequency tables actual function calls. corpus embeddings idfs parameters specified, automatically downloaded corpus specified parameter. Must one "ropensci" "cran". function return similar package specified corpus. fns FALSE (default), load embeddings rOpenSci packages; otherwise load (considerably larger dataset ) embeddings individual functions. raw effect = "calls", case default FALSE loads single Inverse Document Frequency table entire corpus; otherwise TRUE, loads raw function call counts package corpus.

what: Find R packages matching an input of either text or another package ‚Äî pkgmatch_similar_pkgs
title: Find R packages matching an input of either text or another package ‚Äî pkgmatch_similar_pkgs
text: function accepts input either text description, path local R package, returns information R packages best match input. Matches found within specified "corpus", currently packages either rOpenSci's package suite, CRAN. returned object default print method prints best 5 matches directly screen, yet returns information packages within specified corpus. information form data.frame, one column package name, one additional columns integer ranks package. also head method print first entries full data (default n = 5). see data, use .data.frame(). Ranks obtained scores derived : Cosine similarities Large Language Model (LLM) embeddings input, corresponding embeddings specified corpus. "Best Match 25" (BM25) scores based document token frequencies. Ranks text matches generally obtained packages including excluding function descriptions part package text. results four scores input. scores combined final ranking using Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) algorithm. additional parameter llm_proportion determines extent final ranking weights LLM versus BM25 components. Finally, components function locally cached call (memoise package), additional calls function input corpus much faster initial calls. means effect changing llm_proportion can easily examined simply repeating calls function.

title: Find R packages matching an input of either text or another package ‚Äî pkgmatch_similar_pkgs
code: pkgmatch_similar_pkgs(   input,   corpus = "ropensci",   embeddings = NULL,   idfs = NULL,   input_is_code = text_is_code(input),   llm_proportion = 0.5,   n = 5L,   browse = FALSE )

title: Find R packages matching an input of either text or another package ‚Äî pkgmatch_similar_pkgs
text: input Either path local source code R package, text string. corpus embeddings idfs parameters specified, automatically downloaded corpus specified parameter. Must one "ropensci" "cran". function return similar package specified corpus. embeddings Large Language Model embeddings rOpenSci packages, generated pkgmatch_embeddings_from_pkgs. provided, pre-generated embeddings downloaded stored local cache directory. idfs Inverse Document Frequency tables rOpenSci packages, generated pkgmatch_bm25. provided, pre-generated IDF tables downloaded stored local cache directory. input_is_code binary flag indicating whether input code plain text. Ignored input path local package; otherwise can used force appropriate interpretation input type. llm_proportion value 0 1 control relative contributions results Large Language Models ("LLMs") versus results traditional token-frequency models. Final rankings generated combining two kinds results, llm_proportion = 0 return results token frequency analyses , llm_proportion = 1 return results LLMs . n result function printed screen, top n packages displayed. browse TRUE, automatically open webpages top n matches local browser.

title: Find R packages matching an input of either text or another package ‚Äî pkgmatch_similar_pkgs
text: data.frame "package" column naming packages, one columns package ranks terms text similarity , input local path entire R package, similarity code structure. described , default print method prints package names . see full result, use .data.frame().

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ input <- "Download open spatial data from NASA" p <- pkgmatch_similar_pkgs (input) p # Default print method, lists 5 best matching packages head (p) # Shows first 5 rows of full `data.frame` object } # }

what: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
title: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
text: approximate, even software packages can give false negatives identified prose (like rOpenSci's "geonames" package), prose may wrongly identified code.

title: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
code: text_is_code(txt)

title: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
text: txt Single input text string

title: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
text: Logical value indicating whether txt identified code.

title: Estimate whether input text string is code or English prose text. ‚Äî text_is_code
code: txt <- "Some text without any code" text_is_code (txt) #> [1] FALSE txt <- "this_is_code <- function (x) { x }" text_is_code (txt) #> [1] TRUE
